titleStmt.title: S. A. Hurlbut to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1557

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
#38."D." -- 1864.
Head-Quarters 16th Army Corps,
Memphis, Tenn. January 13 1864.
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort Kentucky
Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of Your telegram, dated "Frankfort," and have repeated my previous orders, on the Subject of citizens of Kentucky impressed into the Military Service of the United States, to Brig. Genl. A. J. Smith commanding District of Columbus, at the same time instructing the commanding officer at Island Ten to at once release any such persons.

Very respectfully,
Your obdt. Servt.
S. A. Hurlbut
Major General
Com'dg. 16th. Army Corps.
